name: Twitter List Shortcode
author: Mike Auteri

sections.description: An example of the shortcode looks like this: [twitter_list list=”web-geeks” user=”mauteri” tweets=”5″ height=”300″]. Required fields are user (the Twitter user that created the list) and list (the name of the list created). Optional fields are tweets (default is 5) and height (setting a height may include scrollbars).
sections.installation:
1. Upload twitter-list-shortcode folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Place <?php add_filter('widget_text', 'do_shortcode'); ?> in your functions.php file if you plan on adding the shortcode to a text widget.
sections.changelog:
0.1

  • This is the first version of this plugin.

short_description: Creates a shortcode you can use to embed a Twitter List.
description: An example of the shortcode looks like this: [twitter_list list=”web-geeks” user=”mauteri” tweets=”5″ height=”300″]. Required fields are user (the Twitter user that created the list) and list (the name of the list created). Optional fields are tweets (default is 5) and height (setting a height may include scrollbars).
